hints.content: Start by understanding the structure of the input array. You need to find occurrences of a specific integer, called `key`, and then check what numbers immediately follow it.
Consider using a loop to iterate through the array. You can check each element to see if it matches the `key`. Remember to stop before the last element to avoid out-of-bounds errors.
When you find an occurrence of `key`, look at the next element in the array. This is the number you will count for that specific `key` occurrence.
Use a dictionary or a map to keep track of the counts of each number that follows the `key`. The keys in the dictionary will be the numbers that follow, and the values will be their counts.
Make sure to initialize your dictionary outside of the loop. This way, you can accumulate counts for each number as you find them following the `key`.
After populating your dictionary with counts, you need to determine which number has the highest count. You can do this by iterating through the dictionary.
Remember that the problem guarantees that there will be a unique target with the maximum count. This means you don't need to handle ties in your solution.
When you find the maximum count, keep track of the corresponding number. Ensure you are comparing counts correctly to find the maximum.
Consider edge cases, such as when the `key` appears multiple times in succession. Make sure your logic correctly counts the numbers that follow each occurrence.
Finally, return the number that has the maximum count. Make sure your return statement is correctly formatted to match the expected output.

questionNotes: The `key` is guaranteed to be present in `nums`.
The answer (target with maximum count) is guaranteed to be unique.
